DOC.HEAD: Fire at Mine Briefly Traps Hundreds; All But 5 Out
Eds: UPDATES throughout with all but 5 out.
DOC.TEXT: Fire broke out in a coal mine in northern Spain today, but an estimated 300 workers escaped unharmed, a spokeswoman said. Five miners were missing. The fire at the Mosquitera mine was under control, said Clara Rodriguez, a spokeswoman for the state company Hunosa. Hunosa employees about 21,000 people in 25 mines in the northern region of Asturias.
